markdown:
Esoboks are brute hunters and pugnacious sentinels that serve as the guard dogs of the [Boneyard](/Planes.aspx?ID=15). These squat, powerful quadrupeds have a frill of dark feathers around their distinctive heads which resemble a crocodile skull. Esoboks rarely bother with those who are truly dead, allowing the dead of the Boneyard to go about their business while remaining watchful for danger. Though cunning when sniffing out threats to the Boneyard or to their psychopomp handlers, they're among the least intelligent of the psychopomps and rarely speak except to utter growling threats. The wise listen when an esobok makes a threat, as it won't do so twice. **[Recall Knowledge - Monitor](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 18 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13 [Esobok](/Monsters.aspx?ID=767) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 208 2.0 **Perception** +12; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [lifesense 60 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=21), [scent (imprecise) 60 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19), [Requian](/Languages.aspx?ID=34) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +8, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +10, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +9, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +4, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +8, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +10 **Str** +3 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** -3 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +2 --- **AC** 18 **Fort** +11 **Ref** +8 **Will** +8 **HP** 55 **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46) **Resistances** negative 5, poison 5 --- **Speed** 30 feet **Melee** jaws +12 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 1d10+3 piercing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) and spirit touch **Melee** claw +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 1d6+3 slashing plus spirit touch **Divine Innate Spells** DC 17 - **2nd** [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) (×3; self only) **Pounce** The esobok Strides and then makes a Strike. If it began this action [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22), it remains hidden until after the Strike. **Spirit Touch** An esobok's Strikes affect [incorporeal](/Traits.aspx?ID=222) creatures with the effects of a [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297) property rune and deal 1d6 negative damage to living creatures and 1d6 positive damage to undead. **Wrench Spirit** ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) **Requirement** A creature is [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) by the esobok's jaws; **Effect** The esobok releases the target from the Grab but wrenches its spirit free as it does so. The creature must attempt a DC 20 Will save. Creatures without souls (such as most [constructs](/Traits.aspx?ID=35)) and creatures whose bodies and souls are one (such as most [celestials](/Traits.aspx?ID=23), [fiends](/Traits.aspx?ID=70), and [monitors](/Traits.aspx?ID=303)) that roll a failure or critical failure on the save get a success instead.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The target is [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36).
**Failure** The esobok wrenches the target's soul from its body into its jaws. [Mindless](/Traits.aspx?ID=108) [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) creatures of level 2 or lower are destroyed, other undead creatures are stunned for 1 round, and all other creatures are [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28). At the end of each of its turns, a creature paralyzed by this effect can attempt a new save to end the effect. The paralysis ends automatically if the esobok attempts a jaws Strike or speaks.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but as long as a creature is stunned or paralyzed, it is also [stupefied 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37).
name: Esobok

These squat, powerful quadrupeds have a frill of dark feathers around their distinctive heads which resemble a crocodile skull. Esoboks rarely bother with those who are truly dead, allowing the dead of the Boneyard to go about their business while remaining watchful for danger. Though cunning when sniffing out threats to the Boneyard or to their psychopomp handlers, they're among the least intelligent of the psychopomps and rarely speak except to utter growling threats. The wise listen when an esobok makes a threat, as it won't do so twice.
